pr_title: CUSTCOM-13 A REST management DELETE command returns 415 code instead of 404

timeline.message:
Create an admin REST API test

Created a test to make sure that the REST management API continues
to return a 404 for non-existing resources.

timeline.author: jbee

timeline.message:
Allow the FormReader to read generic maps

When sending null or non-map data to an endpoint with the
x-www-form-urlencoded media type, a generic Map object is created
rather than a specific Map implementation. Because of this no
reader would mark the content as readable and a 415 would be
incorrectly returned.

Create an admin REST API test

Created a test to make sure that the REST management API continues
to return a 404 for non-existing resources.

Create an admin REST API test

Created a test to make sure that the REST management API continues
to return a 404 for non-existing resources.

timeline.bodyText: camel case would be better, but ok.
timeline.author: dmatej

+package fish.payara.samples.rest.management;
+
+import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
+
+import com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.HttpMethod;
+
+import org.junit.Test;
+
+import fish.payara.samples.NotMicroCompatible;
+
+/**
+ * Test the REST management interface for it's basic HTTP responses
+ */
+@NotMicroCompatible
+public class HttpResponsesTest extends RestManagementTest {
+
+    /**
+     * Tests that when deleting a non-existent resource a 404 is returned instead of
+     * a 415. See CUSTCOM-13 for details.
+     */
+    @Test
+    public void when_DELETE_non_existent_resource_expect_404() {
